contents: Chicago specializes in deep-dish pizza, with a thick crust and tomato sauce often poured on top of the cheese. Over two inches thick, it’s baked in a “deep dish” skillet. New York pizza is traditionally thin-crust. You can watch the pizza-makers tossing the big circles of dough in the air and rolling them out until they’re less than half-an-inch thick. They’re put on a thin metal tray, covered with sauce, topped with cheese and slid into the oven.
